00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         mantrigfe.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     Experiment specific readout code (user part) of
00007                 Midas frontend. This example demonstrantes
00008                 the implementation of the manual trigger of
00009                 a periodic event in this case.

00080 /* The frontend name (client name) as seen by other MIDAS clients   */

00082 /* The frontend file name, don't change it */
00083    char *frontend_file_name = __FILE__;
00084

00087

00090

00092    INT max_event_size = 10000;
00093

00095    INT max_event_size_frag = 5 * 1024 * 1024;
00096

00153        EQ_PERIODIC | EQ_MANUAL_TRIG,    /* equipment type */

00176 /********************************************************************\
00177               Callback routines for system transitions
00178 
00179   These routines are called whenever a system transition like start/
00180   stop of a run occurs. The routines are called on the following
00181   occations:
00182 
00183   frontend_init:  When the frontend program is started. This routine
00184                   should initialize the hardware.
00185   
00186   frontend_exit:  When the frontend program is shut down. Can be used
00187                   to releas any locked resources like memory, commu-
00188                   nications ports etc.
00189 
00190   begin_of_run:   When a new run is started. Clear scalers, open
00191                   rungates, etc.
00192 
00193   end_of_run:     Called on a request to stop a run. Can send 
00194                   end-of-run event and close run gates.
00195 
00196   pause_run:      When a run is paused. Should disable trigger events.
00197 
00198   resume_run:     When a run is resumed. Should enable trigger events.
00199 
00200                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           \********************************************************************//*-- Frontend Init -------------------------------------------------*/
00201     INT frontend_init()
00202 {
00203    /* hardware initialization */
00204 
00205    cam_init();
00206    cam_crate_clear(CRATE);
00207    cam_crate_zinit(CRATE);
00208 
00209    /* enable LAM in IO unit */
00210    camc(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 0, 26);
00211 
00212    /* enable LAM in crate controller */
00213    cam_lam_enable(CRATE, SLOT_IO);
00214 
00215    /* reset external LAM Flip-Flop */
00216    camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0xFF);
00217    camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0);
00218 
00219    return SUCCESS;
00220 }
00221 
00222 /*-- Frontend Exit -------------------------------------------------*/
00223 
00224 INT frontend_exit()
00225 {
00226    return SUCCESS;
00227 }

00260 
00261 INT frontend_loop()
00262 {
00263    /* if frontend_call_loop is true, this routine gets called when
00264       the frontend is idle or once between every event */
00265    return SUCCESS;
00266 }

00268 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00269 
00270 /********************************************************************\
00271   
00272   Readout routines for different events
00273 
00274 \********************************************************************/
00275 
00276 /*-- Trigger event routines ----------------------------------------*/
00277 
00278 INT poll_event(INT source, INT count, BOOL test)
00279 /* Polling routine for events. Returns TRUE if event
00280    is available. If test equals TRUE, don't return. The test
00281    flag is used to time the polling */
00282 {
00283    int i;
00284    DWORD lam;
00285 
00286    for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00287       cam_lam_read(LAM_SOURCE_CRATE(source), &lam);
00288 
00289       if (lam & LAM_SOURCE_STATION(source))
00290          if (!test)
00291             return lam;
00292    }
00293 
00294    return 0;
00295 }
00296 
00297 /*-- Interrupt configuration ---------------------------------------*/
00298 
00299 INT interrupt_configure(INT cmd, INT source, PTYPE adr)
00300 {
00301    switch (cmd) {
00302    case CMD_INTERRUPT_ENABLE:
00303       break;
00304    case CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE:
00305       break;
00306    case CMD_INTERRUPT_ATTACH:
00307       break;
00308    case CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH:
00309       break;
00310    }
00311    return SUCCESS;
00312 }
00313 
00314 
00315 /*-- mantrig event --------------------------------------------------*/
00316 
00317 INT read_mantrig_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00318 {
00319    DWORD *pdata, a;
00320 
00321    /* init bank structure */
00322    bk_init(pevent);
00323 
00324    /* create SCLR bank */
00325    bk_create(pevent, "SCLR", TID_DWORD, &pdata);
00326 
00327    /* read scaler bank */
00328    for (a = 0; a < N_SCLR; a++)
00329       cam24i(CRATE, SLOT_SCLR, a, 0, pdata++);
00330 
00331    bk_close(pevent, pdata);
00332 
00333    return bk_size(pevent);
00334 }
